{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the next step when during a diagnostic laparoscopy for undescended testis, there are absent testicular vessels. According to Document [31], laparoscopy is the only reliable diagnostic method for absent testis, which has a high incidence in children with non palpable testes. The finding of the blind-ending spermatic veins and deferent duct confirms the diagnosis of absent testis. Therefore, if there are absent testicular vessels, it indicates that the testis is absent and no further exploration is needed.", "answer_choice": "B. Nothing is to be done"}
